definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: The only one ancient county government saved so completely, which was built in Yuan dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 全國唯一保存完整的郡府級衙門，始建於元朝。

sentences.english: No sooner had Shanghai acquired its township status than it had its first Confucian Temple.
sentences.chinese: 上海設鎮後，始建文廟，後來地址多有遷移。

sentences.english: It was build in 1998. All the advanced equipment and technology was introduced from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 於1998年始建，全部從國外引進先進設備和工藝。

sentences.english: Buddha Temple was built in Northern Wei Dynasty, and later destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 佛光寺始建於北魏，後來被毀。

definition: to build (for the first time)/to create (a building)
old site/site of sth (palace, ancient state etc) that no longer exists
to reconstruct/to repair/to revamp/to revise/to retake a failed course
a record of events inscribed on a tablet
the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
old term/old way of referring to sth
seat of prefectural government (from Tang to Qing times)
